description: The Corrections Service of Canada has posted an advanced contract award notice (ACAN) for the procurement of vocational rehabilitation services. The contract is for the supply of such services, including residential facilities, to federal offenders on conditional release, statutory release, and those subject to Long-Term Supervision Orders. This ACAN is related to the procurement of vocational rehabilitation services. The CSC is a federal organization responsible for administering sentences of two (2) years or more imposed by the courts. The correctional facilities of the CSC provide accommodations, treatment, monitoring, and support to offenders on conditional release, statutory release, and those subject to long-term supervision. The services include residential services, security services, and assistance in reintegrating into society. The procurement is subject to the Government Contracts Regulations. The pre-identified supplier for the contract is La Maison Carignan Inc. In deciding whether the notice was valid, the following information was considered: the notice number and type are 21301-25-4554214 - Advance Contract Award Notice. The notice is being published on the government's contracting website.  The notice was published 20 days before the closing date, and the notice should have been published at least 30 days before the closing date. However, given the exceptional circumstances, the notice was deemed valid. The notice should have been published in both official languages.  The notice was  published in French and English. The notice should be opened only to qualified suppliers. During an initial review of the bid notice, the following information was found: 1. The name of the contracting parties was identified: the Government of Canada is the contracting party while La Maison Carignan Inc. is the preselected supplier. They have a one-year contract commencing April 1st, 2024, with a total of five options to continue the contract. The contract duration is one year from April 1, 2024, to March 31, 2025. # Government Tender Announcement

### Project Title
Treatment Centres

### Reference Number
cb-43-89773268

### Tender Closing Date
Thursday, February 21st, 2024
14:00:00 Eastern Daylight Time (EDT)

### Objective
The Correctional Service of Canada (CSC) invites interested suppliers to provide services for treatment centres in Quebec (excluding the National Capital Region). The selected supplier will be responsible for providing residential services, treatment, and support to offenders on conditional release, statutory release, and those subject to long-term supervision orders.

### Intended Procurement
The contract will be awarded to a pre-identified supplier, as only a limited number of qualified service providers are available in the identified locations.

### Requirements
The supplier must have a minimum of two years of experience in working with adult offenders on conditional release and providing accommodation services in a residential setting. The organization must be a non-profit, duly recognized corporation governed by a board of directors from the community, and accredited by federal authorities.

### Deliverables
The supplier will be responsible for providing the following services:

* Residential services for federal offenders on conditional release
* Security services, including monitoring of resident activities and destinations
* Assisting residents in their reintegration efforts, including providing basic referral services to community support groups and other agencies
* Ongoing liaison with local police agencies

### Security Clearance
The supplier must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) with approved Document Safeguarding Capability (DSC) at the level of PROTECTED B, issued by the Canadian Industrial Security Directorate (CISD) of Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

### Evaluation Criteria
Statements of capabilities will be evaluated against the following criteria:

* Experience: Minimum two years of experience in working with adult offenders on conditional release and providing accommodation services in a residential setting
* Organization: Non-profit, duly recognized corporation governed by a board of directors from the community, accredited by federal authorities

### Statement of Capabilities
Suppliers who consider themselves fully qualified and available to provide the services described in this notice may submit a statement of capabilities in writing to the contact person identified below on or before the closing date and time.
